sen.j: 建振熊命（たけふるくまのみこと）、難波根子建振熊（なにわねこたけふるくま）は、古墳時代の人物。
sen.e: Takefurukuma no mikoto (武振熊命) was a figure who lived in the Kofun period (tumulus period), whose name was also written as 建振熊命(Takefurukuma no mikoto) and who was also called Naniwanekotakefurukuma (難波根子建振熊).
sen.cmt: 名前漢字表記を入れました。 難波根子建振熊（なにわねこたけふるくま）→Naniwanekotakefurukuma
sen.e: Takefurukuma no mikoto (武振熊命) was a figure in the Kofun period (tumulus period), whose name was also written as 建振熊命(Takefurukuma no mikoto) and who was also called Naniwanekotakefurukuma (難波根子建振熊).
Takefurukuma no mikoto (武振熊命) was a figure in the Kofun period (tumulus period), whose name was also written as 建振熊命(Takefurukuma no mikoto) and who was also called Naniwanekotakefurukuma (難波根子建振熊).

sen.j: 神功皇后に仕えた将軍。
sen.e: He was a shogun (great general), who served Empress Jingu.
He was a shogun (great general), who served Empress Jingu.
He was a shogun (great general), who served Empress Jingu.

sen.j: 「神功紀」によると、三韓征伐より帰還した皇后の畿内入りを阻止しようとした忍熊王の軍を破った。
sen.e: According to "Jingugi" (Chronicle of Empress Jingu), he defeated the army of Shikuma no mikoto, who tried to impede the Empress's path to enter the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara), when she was on the way back from the Sankan seibatsu (the conquest of three countries in ancient Korea).

According to "Jingugi" (Chronicle of Empress Jingu), he defeated the army of Shikuma no mikoto, who tried to prevent the Empress from entering the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara), when she was on the way back from the Sankan seibatsu (the conquest of three countries in ancient Korea).
sen.cmt: impede the Empress's path to enter を prevent the Empress from enteringに変更
sen.e: According to "Jingugi" (Chronicle of Empress Jingu), he defeated the army of Shikuma no mikoto, who tried to prevent the Empress from entering the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara), when she was on the way back from the Sankan seibatsu (the conquest of three countries in ancient Korea).

sen.j: また、「仁徳紀」には天皇家に従わない飛騨国の怪物両面宿儺を退治したともある。
sen.e: According to the "Nintokugi" (Chronicle of Emperor Nintoku), he exterminated a double faced specter called 'Ryomensukuna,' who did not swore his allegiance to the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: 怪物両面宿儺→a double faced specter called Ryomensukunaとしました。
sen.e: According to the "Nintokugi" (Chronicle of Emperor Nintoku), he exterminated a double faced specter called 'Ryomensukuna,' who did not swear his allegiance to the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: did not swore を did not swearに変更
sen.e: According to the "Nintokugi" (Chronicle of Emperor Nintoku), he exterminated a double faced specter called 'Ryomensukuna,' who did not swear his allegiance to the Imperial family.
He was the ancestor of the Wani uji clan
sen.cmt: 和珥氏→ the Wani uji clanとしました。
sen.e: He was the ancestor of the Wani uji clan
He was the ancestor of the Wani uji clan

sen.j: ちなみに、籠神社に伝わる国宝海部氏系図に、天火明命を祖とする海部氏の19代目に同名の人物が見える。
sen.e: Kono-jinja Shrine keeps the Kaifu clan genealogical table designated as a National Treasure, and in this table a person who had the same name as Takefurukuma no mikoto was registered as the 19th generation of the Kaifu clan, the clan that had been proclaiming its lineage with Ame no Hoakari (one of the gods in Japanese mythology).
sen.cmt: 国宝海部氏系図→the Kaifu clan genealogical table designated as a National Treasureとしました。 同名→the same name as Takefurukuma no mikotoとしました。 天火明命→Ame no Hoakari (one of the gods in Japanese mythology)としました。Ame no Hoakari no Mikotoとも読むようです。
sen.e: Kono-jinja Shrine keeps the Kaifu clan genealogical table designated as a National Treasure, and in this table a person who had the same name as Takefurukuma no mikoto is registered as the 19th generation of the Kaifu clan, the clan that proclaimed its lineage with Ame no Hoakari (one of the gods in Japanese mythology).

Kono-jinja Shrine keeps the Kaifu clan genealogical table designated as a National Treasure, and in this table a person who had the same name as Takefurukuma no mikoto is registered as the 19th generation of the Kaifu clan, the clan that proclaimed its lineage with Ame no Hoakari (one of the gods in Japanese mythology).
